sentences.sContent: Ecological sciences were only dimly understood in the late 19th century.
sentences.sContent_eng: Ecological sciences were only dimly understood in the late 19th century.
sentences.sCn: 19世纪末，人们对生态科学只有朦胧的认识。

sentences.sContent: Ayer was dimly known to me, England being one of those rare countries in which each era has a few public philosophers — respected thinkers who are called upon to comment on the issues of the day.
sentences.sContent_eng: Ayer was dimly known to me, England being one of those rare countries in which each era has a few public philosophers — respected thinkers who are called upon to comment on the issues of the day.
sentences.sCn: 我对艾耶尔有些朦胧的认识，很少有国家在每个时代都有几个公众哲学家——曾受邀就当时问题发表看法的受人尊重的思想者，英国正是其中之一。

words.tran: 暗淡的，昏暗的；模糊的，看不清的；悲观的，怀疑的
[车辆] 调光器；光暗掣；衰减器
使暗淡；变模糊（dim的过去式）
使暗淡，使失去光泽；使变模糊
